page.title: 04Farming in Cheshire 1
page.content:
There are two main farms in Weston. The name of our farm is Carters Green farm. We have two modern sheds. Each bay is about three meters in length. One shed has ten bays along it. There are three rows. The other has ten bays along and five bays across. We have a smaller shed which has four bays. There are one hundred and seventy cows in our herd. The parlour is modern it has automatic cluster removes In the winter we feed the cows on silage and in the shed it has automatic scrapers for gathering up the manure.
We make our own meal for the cows by rolling the grains of corn. We have a roller. The corn is put in a hopper and it goes through two metal rollers. We have five tractors and a lot of inplements. We make our own silage. We put a speacial acid with the mown
